problems.title: Vacuum Won't Turn On or Start
problems.description: Diagnosing why your Shark Rocket brush not spinning won't power on.
possible_causes: Battery is dead and needs replacement
solution_steps: Charge the vacuum for at least 4 hours
Look for any error lights or beeps
If completely dead, battery replacement is likely needed

required_parts.name: Shark Rocket brush not spinning Diagnostic Tool
required_parts.search_query: Shark Rocket brush not spinning troubleshooting

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the issue on a Shark Rocket brush not spinning?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement part typically costs significantly less than a new $385 vacuum, and extending the life of your Shark is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my Shark Rocket brush not spinning needs a new part?
faqs.answer: Common signs include intermittent power and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the part on my Shark Rocket brush not spinning myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
